summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 20, 2019. It demands the production of extensive records related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including institutional count slips, logs, staff assignments, and communications, for an investigation into potential violations of federal law. The subpoena includes a confidentiality request and requires an MCC employee to appear before the grand jury on September 10, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, signing the document and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the inmate (Reg. No. 76318-054) whose records, including Form 292 and related communications, are the subject of the subpoena.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a grand jury subpoena to investigate matters related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to MCC
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to the Metropolitan Correctional Center demanding preservation and production of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and institutional procedures.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: An MCC employee designated as custodian of records is commanded to appear before the grand jury to produce materials and be examined.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007

The Silvio J. Mollo Building (One Saint Andrew's Plaza), New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 20, 2019, as part of a criminal investigation into potential violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371, 1001, 1519, and 2.
The subpoena specifically demands all documents related to inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054), including his Form 292, communications, and institutional count records.

The requested documents cover the period from June 1, 2019, to the present, with a preservation request extending back to January 1, 2019, indicating a focus on events surrounding Epstein's incarceration.

The subpoena demands records related to institutional counts, 30-minute rounds, logs (visitor, attorney, lieutenant's), staff assignments, and the 'High Risk List,' suggesting an investigation into prison procedures and monitoring.
The U.S. Attorney's office requested confidentiality, asking the MCC not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to third parties to preserve the investigation's integrity.
